paper_abstract: We propose a multiparty protocol for comparator networks which are used to compute various functions in statistical analysis, such as the maximum, minimum, median, and quartiles, for example, through sorting and searching. In the protocol, all values which are inputted to a comparator network and all intermediate outputs are kept secret assuming the presence of an honest majority. We also introduce an application of the protocol for a secure (M + 1)-st price auction.
paper_title: Secure multiparty computation for comparator networks
